Instance.description: An interaction that displays Club data and runs specific behavior.

TunableList.name: club_actions
TunableList.description: A list of actions to perform, in order, on the selected Club.

TunableVariant.description: An action to execute on the specified club.

TunableTuple.name: challenge
TunableTuple.description: Run interaction to convey the idea that the selected Club has been challenged: * Run a specific interaction on the Club leader * Run specific interaction to Sims not participating in the challenge.

Tunable.name: challenge_game
Tunable.description: The game that the club is being challenged at. This is used to determine how many Sims are required, per team.

Tunable.name: challenge_interaction
Tunable.description: The interaction to push on the Sims being challenged.

Tunable.name: challenge_social_interaction
Tunable.description: Specify an interaction that the challenging Sim runs on a Sim in the challenged club (usually the leader). Once this interaction completes, the challenge executes.

TunableTuple.name: lock_portal
TunableTuple.description: Lock the target portal of this interaction for non-members of the selected Club.

TunableEnum.name: clear_existing_locks
TunableEnum.description: Which existing locks should be cleared before adding the new Club lock.

TunableTuple.name: club_lock
TunableTuple.description: The Club lock to apply to the target portal.

TunableList.name: except_club_seeds
TunableList.description: Sims that are members of these Clubs are exempted from being locked by the object.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

Tunable.name: replace_lock_type
Tunable.description: If checked, then the specified Club lock replaces any existing Club lock, i.e. the only allowed Club is the new Club. If unchecked, then the operation is additive: any Clubs specified for this lock are also allowed, alongside any Clubs previously allowed.

TunableTuple.name: npc_summon
TunableTuple.description: Summon all members of the picked Club to the current lot.

TunableEnum.name: purpose
TunableEnum.description: The purpose/reason the NPC is being summoned.

TunableTuple.name: push_interaction
TunableTuple.description: Push a Club super interaction associated with the selected Club.

TunableEnum.name: actor
TunableEnum.description: The Sim on which the affordance is pushed.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push as a continuation on the specified actor Sim.

TunableVariant.name: carry_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a carry target for this continuation.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant the affordance will set as a carry target.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_carry_target
TunableVariant.description: Item in inventory (of continuations actor) to use as carry target for continuation if carry target is None

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The base definition to look for inside inventory. Objects that redirect (like counters) will match if base definition is the same.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The exact object definition to look for inside inventory.

TunableTuple.name: object_with_tag
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: preserve_preferred_object
Tunable.description: If checked, the pushed interaction's preferred objects are determined by the current preferred objects. If unchecked, the transition sequence would not award bonuses to any specific part.

Tunable.name: preserve_target_part
Tunable.description: If checked, the pushed interaction will use the same target part if applicable. Defaults to false because typically we will want to let the transition select which part to use.

Tunable.name: si_affordance_override
Tunable.description: When the tuned affordance is a mixer for a different SI, use this to specify the mixer's appropriate SI. This is useful for pushing socials.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The participant the affordance will target.

TunableVariant.name: club_generator
TunableVariant.description: Define which Clubs are generated for this picker interaction.

TunableTuple.name: from_gatherings
TunableTuple.description: Generate all Clubs with an ongoing Club gathering except that Club whose gathering the Sim is a member of. Return no Clubs if the Sim is not actively participating in a Club gathering.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Generate clubs based on participants' membership.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: All Clubs this Sim is a member of will be generated, provided they don't conflict with the tuned blacklist.

TunableVariant.name: subject_blacklist
TunableVariant.description: If specified, some Clubs will not be generated.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: No Clubs this Sim is a member of will be generated, even if the specified subject is a member.

Tunable.name: force_pie_menu_category
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the pie_menu_category tuned here even if the row_data (for instance, recipes) of this picker normally specify their own picker categories. This can be useful when re-using row data in a new pie menu picker with a different intended category.

Tunable.name: pie_menu_category
Tunable.description: If set, then the generated Pie Menu interaction will be categorized under this Pie Menu category, as opposed to using the interaction's Pie Menu category.

Tunable.name: pie_menu_name
Tunable.description: The localized name for the pie menu item. The content should always have {2.String} to wrap picker row data's name.

Tunable.name: show_disabled_item
Tunable.description: If checked, the disabled item will show as disabled in the Pie Menu with a greyed-out tooltip. Otherwise the disabled item will not show up in the pie menu.
